poem:
**Residues of Smoke**

In white-walled Doha,  
the sky swallows  
plumes of disbelief—  
smoke climbs high,  
towers over  
shadows fleeing  
a tapestry of lives  
woven tight, unraveling  
in the noise, the flame—  
while beneath,  
hearts echo  
words unsaid,  
laws and dust  
settle  
side by side.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Qatar condemns ‘criminal assault’ as Israel targets Hamas leaders in Doha – Middle East crisis live 2.52pm BST Video footage from Doha, shared on social media and on local television channels, showed what appeared to be a huge blast centred on a residential area of white walled compounds with smoke towering above the city and residents running for safety. 2.42pm BST Qatar condemns 'cowardly criminal assault' on Doha it says violated international laws Dr Majed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Qatar condemns ‘criminal assault’ as Israel targets Hamas leaders in Doha – Middle East crisis live 2.52pm BST Video footage from Doha, shared on social media and on local television channels, showed what appeared to be a huge blast centred on a residential area of white walled compounds with smoke towering above the city and residents running for safety. 2.42pm BST Qatar condemns 'cowardly criminal assault' on Doha it says violated international laws Dr Majed
